A Cycling Year.AUTHOR: Heather Dawe
A Cycling Year.REVIEW: I loved reading this book. The stories are heart-warming and genuine, and the accompanying images are stunning. What's more, she lives in Otley, which is a stone's throw from me, so all the stories are on local cycling roads.
A Cycling Year.TITLE: A Cycling Year

Beyond the Pale.AUTHOR: Matthew Turner
Beyond the Pale.REVIEW: It was a little repetitive, could have been shorter. As an entrepreneur though some of the story did resonate with me.
Beyond the Pale.TITLE: Beyond the Pale

Born to Run.AUTHOR: Christopher McDougall
Born to Run.REVIEW: I absolutely love this book, it's easily one of my favourites. I love that its an entertaining story, packed with facts, and has heaps on inspo to get my outside to run! Would highly recommend!
Born to Run.TITLE: Born to Run

Can't Sleep, Can't Train, Can't Stop.AUTHOR: Andy Holgate
Can't Sleep, Can't Train, Can't Stop.REVIEW: As a triathlete who is always in the wars, this book really spoke to me.
Can't Sleep, Can't Train, Can't Stop.TITLE: Can't Sleep, Can't Train, Can't Stop

Cycling Land's End to John O'Groats.AUTHOR: Sean Conway
Cycling Land's End to John O'Groats.REVIEW: The writing style is a bit basic, but being his first book this isn't much of a surprise. The story is brilliant thoiugh.
Cycling Land's End to John O'Groats.TITLE: Cycling Land's End to John O'Groats

Cycling's Strangest Tales.AUTHOR: Iain Spragg
Cycling's Strangest Tales.REVIEW: There are some hilariuous stories in here!
Cycling's Strangest Tales.TITLE: Cycling's Strangest Tales

Iron War.AUTHOR: Matt Fitzgerald
Iron War.REVIEW: Need to refresh my memory on this one!
Iron War.TITLE: Iron War

Leeds Trinity University - Inspiring Fut.AUTHOR: Leeds Trinity University
Leeds Trinity University - Inspiring Fut.TITLE: Leeds Trinity University - Inspiring Futures Since 1966

Mindful Thoughts for Cyclists.AUTHOR: Nick Moore
Mindful Thoughts for Cyclists.REVIEW: A short book that makes you think differently.
Mindful Thoughts for Cyclists.TITLE: Mindful Thoughts for Cyclists

Misadventures in Entrepreneuring.AUTHOR: Gayle Mann and Lucy-Rose Walker
Misadventures in Entrepreneuring.REVIEW: Real-life stories from entrepreneurs who have been there and done it. Even better that I contributed to it!
Misadventures in Entrepreneuring.TITLE: Misadventures in Entrepreneuring

Mud, Sweat, and Tears.AUTHOR: Bear Grylls
Mud, Sweat, and Tears.REVIEW: This was an alright book but not the best. It was interesting reading about his journey but a little bit preachy for me.
Mud, Sweat, and Tears.TITLE: Mud, Sweat, and Tears

Steve Jobs.AUTHOR: Walter Isaacson
Steve Jobs.REVIEW: A real deep-dive into the life of a clear genius. A tough books to get through, which took me many tries, but well worth the read.
Steve Jobs.TITLE: Steve Jobs

The Hour.AUTHOR: Michael Hutchinson
The Hour.REVIEW: Really liked this book. Not everything needs a happy ending, but the lesson is no less powerful.
The Hour.TITLE: The Hour

The Man Who Cycled the World.AUTHOR: Mark Beaumont
The Man Who Cycled the World.REVIEW: I enjoyed it but his descriptions where a little lacking in places. I guess it's because he literally had his head down pedalling for the most part.
The Man Who Cycled the World.TITLE: The Man Who Cycled the World

The Rise of the Ultra Runners.AUTHOR: Adharanand Finn
The Rise of the Ultra Runners.REVIEW: Need to refresh my memory on this one!
The Rise of the Ultra Runners.TITLE: The Rise of the Ultra Runners

The Salt Path.AUTHOR: Raynor Winn
The Salt Path.REVIEW: This story is brutal at times and puts into sharp perspective just what's important in life.
The Salt Path.TITLE: The Salt Path

The Scavenger Mindset.AUTHOR: Clare Richmond
The Scavenger Mindset.REVIEW: I really enjoyed this book. It teaches you that everyone can make an impact on their community.
The Scavenger Mindset.TITLE: The Scavenger Mindset

Together.AUTHOR: Vivek H. Murthy
Together.REVIEW: Loneliness is close to my heart. This was a tough read but the stories needed to be shared. Would highly recommend to anyone with an interest in the power of social connection.
Together.TITLE: Together

Too Many Reasons to Live.AUTHOR: Rob Burrow
Too Many Reasons to Live.REVIEW: A loved reading about the backroom antics, and learnt loads about his career that I had no idea took place. It was a little MND-heavy but for obvious reasons I understand why. A good read for any sport fan.
Too Many Reasons to Live.TITLE: Too Many Reasons to Live

Ultrmarathon Man.AUTHOR: Dean Karnazes
Ultrmarathon Man.REVIEW: This was a good book with a good story, but he does bang on about how awesome he is too much.
Ultrmarathon Man.TITLE: Ultrmarathon Man
